duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the daily functions of the Patient Relations Representatives Department.
Act as a facilitator for health system patients’ family members and patients’ designated representatives to achieve resolution to their concerns or complaints.
Coordinate communication between patient/families and the healthcare team to expedite the best outcomes for the patient.
Document patient complaints and assess areas for improvement based on daily interactions with patients and observations.
Maintain sensitivity to cultural diversity and effectively interact with a multicultural patient and guest population.
Respond to and resolve patient concerns and problems in an effective and timely manner, exhibiting the highest degree of professionalism, friendliness, helpfulness, and customer service.
Collaborate with department managers to meet patient expectations and quality outcomes, building a patient-focused culture.
Maintain knowledge and understanding of Medicare/Medicaid, IDPH guidelines, JCAHO, OSHA, and DOH regulations and compliance standards.
Assist with the patient’s needs or a referral to the appropriate staff and answer general questions and/or relay messages to the appropriate personnel.
Coordinate the investigation and analyze grievances/complaints/concerns with appropriate parties and departments for resolution.
Effectively communicate the findings of grievances/reviews to the patient in writing.
Support staff in the facilitation of Service Recovery opportunities, responding to the needs and concerns of patients, families, and other customers.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree preferred; Experience: 3-5 years’ experience in a healthcare-related field.
